snippet: The secretary of state told Ahmed al-Jarba that the president was still determined to hold the Syrian government accountable for a chemical weapons attack.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry calls Ahmad al-Jarba, leader of Syrian opposition, to assure him that Pres Obama is determined to hold Syrian government accountable for chemical weapons attack,  despite his decision to seek Congressional approval before any such action.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and THOM SHANKER

lead_paragraph: The secretary of state told Ahmed al-Jarba that the president was still determined to hold the Syrian government accountable for a chemical weapons attack.

headline.main: Kerry Seeks to Reassure Syrian Opposition Leader
headline.print_headline: After Obama Postpones Action, Kerry Seeks to Reassure Syrian Opposition Leader
